alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, southwestern Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Level Green, or 7 miles southwest of Mount Vernon, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hansford, Wabp and Pongo around 335 PM EDT. Sand Springs, Spiro, Maretburg and Luner around 340 PM EDT. Wellhope around 345 PM EDT. Burr, Pine Hill, Sand Hill, Renfro Valley, Lake Linville, Hiatt and Camp Wildcat around 350 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Vernon, Flat Rock, Orlando, Dudley Station, Sinks, Hummel, Muellersville, Gauley, Donaro, Withers, Wildie, Roundstone, Lamero, Cooksburg, Robinet, Bummer, Jep Hill, Horse Lick, Cruise, Templer, Johnetta, Goochland, Climax, Dango, Ardery, Disputanta, Carico and Middlefork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
